item.title: 5 Best Handheld Spider-Man Games
item.description:
Few superheros have translated to the video gaming medium as perfectly as Spider-Man. Marvel’s most beloved hero has frequently proven to be a perfect fit for gaming with his thrilling web-slinging, acrobatic combat, and colorful array of villains to contend with.

While home console hits such as Insomniac’s Spider-Man games have dominated in recent years, Peter Parker is no stranger to the world of handheld gaming, either. From old school adventures to handheld renditions of popular home console hits, Spider-Man has gotten up to all kinds of trouble within the handheld scene. Of the many games fitting this bill out there, a select few stand out from the rest for their on-point adaptations of the New York City-based superhero.

5 Spider-Man: Friend Or Foe

Provides Colorful Looks At Many Classic Spidey Villains

  • Release date : October 2, 2007
  • Handheld platforms : PlayStation Portable, Nintendo DS
  • Developer : Artificial Mind & Movement

This light-hearted, kid-friendly beat ‘em up is brimming with classic Spidey villains. The plot of Spider-Man: Friend or Foe revolves around bizarre monsters known as P.H.A.N.T.O.M.s, with Spider-Man taking on allies in his bid to vanquish them.

For those who played it on PSP, a surprise unlockable character to play presents itself in the form of the bloodthirsty Carnage. Having one of Spider-Man’s most infamous rogues pop in as a playable character immediately gives this game some surprising niche value. With plenty of fighting action, and some mystery to uncover over the course of the plot, Friend or Foe makes for a fun diversion.

4 Spider-Man: Battle For New York

An Action-Packed Look At The Ultimate Universe

  • Release date : November 14, 2006
  • Handheld platforms : Nintendo DS, Game Boy Advance
  • Developer : Torus Games

This Ultimate Spider-Man prequel, Battle for New York , highlights the always bitter feud between the web-slinger and the Green Goblin. Here, Norman Osborn’s infamous Oz Formula rears its ugly head again, being used on the people of New York City.

With a horde of monstrous goblins now roaming the streets, it falls to Spider-Man to put a stop to his hated nemesis’ attack on the city. Interestingly, the Green Goblin is also a playable character for a change here, making this an especially exciting bit of gaming for fans of the diabolical menace. The DS version provides a relatively straightforward action adventure for players, bolstered by its entertaining characters and a surprise appearance from The Ultimates.

3 Spider-Man: Web Of Shadows

An Intriguing, Symbiote-Focused Mystery

  • Release date : October 21, 2008
  • Handheld platforms : PlayStation Portable, Nintendo DS
  • Developer : Griptonite Games, Amaze Entertainment

The handheld versions of this choice-focused Spidey adventure offer a notably different gaming experience. The PSP version of Web of Shadows, in particular, changes the action due to sporting 2.5D graphics.

Both the PSP and Nintendo DS versions also offer noticeably different renditions of the plot with, frustratingly, fewer endings to choose from. Despite that issue, the handheld versions still offer a thrilling adventure through a symbiote-infested Manhattan. The DS version also provides surprise new allies in the form of popular X-Men hero Nightcrawler and, in a surprising twist, the Green Goblin as well. With plenty of web-slinging beatdowns to hand out to Spider-Man’s extensive rogues' gallery, Web of Shadows remains an exciting wall-crawling adventure regardless of the console.

2 Ultimate Spider-Man

A Must-Play For Fans Of The Comic Book Series

  • Release date : September 22, 2005
  • Handheld platforms : Nintendo DS, Game Boy Advance, Mobile phone
  • Developer : Vicarious Visions, Mforma

This adaptation of the hit comic-book series has come to enjoy a glowing reputation in the years since its release. Sporting a distinctive art style modeled on Mark Bagley’s comic art, Ultimate Spider-Man follows the crime-fighting adventures of the Ultimate universe's take on Peter Parker.

While the Game Boy Advance rendition of the game did not quite set the world on fire, the Nintendo DS take provided the web-slinging goods. With a rich storyline full of classic heroes and villains for Spider-Man to interact with, the game remains compelling throughout. On top of getting to play as Peter Parker, Eddie Brock’s monstrous alter-ego, Venom, also spends time in the player’s control, further diversifying the gameplay and action on offer.

1 Spider-Man: Mysterio’s Menace

Provides A Great Showcase Of The Titular Villain

  • Release date : September 18, 2001
  • Handheld platforms : Game Boy Advance
  • Developer : Vicarious Visions

Following on from the events of Enter Electro , this action-packed effort sees Peter Parker throw down with seven distinct enemies. Loaded with neat cutscenes modeled on comic-book panel art, Mysterio's Menace follows a straightforward plot of Spider-Man tackling a crime wave over one night.

Along with the return of Electro, Spider-Man also collides with classic rogues such as Rhino, Hammerhead, and the titular Mysterio. As is to be expected from handheld games of its time, Mysterio’s Menace largely follows a side-scrolling, platforming format. Basic but fun and focused, Mysterio’s Menace is another on-point entry in the classic early noughties series of the character.

item.title: 6 Best Platformers With Local Co-Op
item.description:
Highlights

  • Platformers challenge gamers to rely on reflexes and memory skills, offering a test of speed and fun co-op experiences.
  • Games like It Takes Two and Spelunky 2 require teamwork and trust-building for success in the virtual world.
  • Titles like Rayman Legends and LittleBigPlanet offer visually stunning levels and creative opportunities for cooperative play.

Platformers are one of the purest forms of video gaming, testing gamers' skills against a myriad of preset challenges. They provide numerous gauntlets that a player will need to use their reflexes alone to overcome during their first attempt and then the application of their memory skills for subsequent runs.

While playing a platformer solo can be a true test of skill for speedrunners, some gamers just want to have fun with friends who are sitting next to them. This is where couch co-op transforms a gaming experience into one that can strengthen bonds. Some co-op platformers even offer this same experience as an online option for when one's gamer friends are not in the same room.

6 It Takes Two

Specifically Built To Be Played By Two Players

Hazelight Studios is no stranger to delving into the co-op experience. It Takes Two is stuffed full of numerous activities that require both players to pull their weight, or else they will be met with failure. This doesn’t feel like just a game; it feels like a trust-building exercise in video game form. As such, players will have a small learning curve to overcome.

It Takes Two is oozing with charm. The story follows May and Cody as they are shrunk down and forced to explore the oversized world around them, and there is a sense of wonder looming around every corner. Any duo that is looking for their next co-op story-driven masterpiece are certain to enjoy what this title has to offer.

5 Spelunky 2

A Cave Diving Roguelike That Four Players Can Enjoy

The original Spelunky was a flawless game that handled every aspect of its design right, and it was a pleasant surprise to see that the developers could surpass themselves with the follow-up entry. Death lurks around every corner in Spelunky 2 , as a single wrong step can result in the player having to restart their expedition from the very start — as is common for almost all great roguelike games around.

The more a player plays, the better they get at the game. This allows them to reach the deepest levels faster than before and increase how far they are able to go each time. The game allows up to three friends to come along with each expedition, with each run being a different experience from the last with different items to help along the way.

4 Rayman Legends

An Unforgetting Visual & Musical Experience For Up To Four Players

Rayman Legends is a top-tier 2D platforming experience, with incredibly well-designed levels that will never feel old or stale as players make their way to the very end of the game. One of the most enjoyable aspects of the game is watching as one’s actions, such as jumping and attacking, seamlessly sync up to the music in the background while imminent death chases close behind.

This title serves as a direct sequel to Rayman Origins , which still manages to be worth playing to this very day. Friends will be able to just pick up a controller and drop right in at any moment in the game.

3 LittleBigPlanet (Series)

A Remarkable Co-Op Experience That Encourages Creativity

LittleBigPlanet offered an adorable mascot named Sackboy, whom players could explore a very deep well of customization with — down to the very material the little guy is made from. Players could also switch up their emotions with the D-pad to suit the situation they found themselves in.

The first game featured some of the most powerful and revolutionary level design tools ever seen in video game history, with players being able to replicate those very levels that the story used — as well as whatever else their imagination could dream up. Each game offers more tools to create with, and this allows for more complex creations. On top of being an incredibly fun game to play solo, gamers are also able to experience every element of the title with up to three of their friends in both local and online co-op.

2 Portal 2

A Puzzle-Focused Platformer That Requires Two Players To Work Together

The first Portal game hit the gaming world very hard and instantly became a classic by doing so many incredible things. It featured fun gameplay, a compelling story, and the narration delivered by GLaDOS was well received by critics and fans alike. The core premise revolved around using the iconic Portal Gun to permit players to instantly access another part of the puzzle room, which could allow gamers to manipulate objects and build momentum to solve puzzles that would otherwise be unsolvable.

In Portal 2 , the developers added a complete co-op experience where two players, be it online or locally, would need to think and work together in order to progress. This is one of the most rewarding teamwork experiences that two friends can have together in the realm of gaming.

1 Super Mario Bros. Wonder

An Iconic Mario Experience For Up To Four Players

Over the course of the Super Mario franchise’s lifetime, it has continued to take what it learned from previous games and improve upon them. Super Mario Bros. Wonder offers co-op for up to four players but only as a local feature, meaning that friends will need to be close by if they wish to play together. The game offers one of the best Mario experiences out there, with vivid colors, stellar visuals, and a whimsical soundtrack.

As players progress through the game's numerous worlds, they will discover many different power-ups and will regularly be delighted by the constant cascade of new elements from the various levels. There is also a whole new range of enemies, with each requiring a different approach to be taken down.

item.title: 7 Days To Die: Where To Find Beakers
item.description:
Apart from needing crafting stations, players in 7 Days To Die also need to find the right implements if they want to make their own supplies and equipment. One example of these tools are Beakers, which are needed for crafting different chemical-based items.

Medicine and chemical-based ingredients are essential for keeping yourself alive, and if you're going to dive into 7 Days To Die's many POIs, you'll need a stock of emergency supplies in case you get injured. You'll only need one Beaker to meet your crafting needs, and if you're having trouble finding one, this guide should help you out.

Where To Find Beakers In 7 Days To Die

You can sometimes find a Beaker in Pop-N-Pills crates, medicine cabinets, and containers inside garages. Unfortunately, you can't craft Beakers of your own, which means you'll really have to pick those POIs clean. Apart from sealed crates, containers like Chemistry Sets and Medical Supplies also have decent chances of containing a Beaker.

Another reliable way of finding a Beaker is to check trader compounds. If you're planning on doing business with traders in 7 Days To Die , it's best to check their compound for loot containers before leaving. If you're looking for Beakers, sweep the compounds for Destroyed Chemistry Stations . They can also contain useful resources like wood and coal, and they may even have magazines that improve your crafting skills.

You could always check trader inventories if they have any Beakers for sale. Trader Jen specializes in medical/chemical supplies; visit her if you aren't having any luck with the others.

Consumables and Loot Stage

If you're not having much luck finding Beakers during your scavenging run, consider buying some Eye Candy from a vending machine. This is a consumable item that gives you both a flat and a percentage Loot Bonus buff for six minutes. Essentially, this increases your chances of finding rare and better-quality loot.

For those who are unaware, biomes and POIs have difficulty ratings marked by the number of skulls they have on their name tags (found on the upper-right side of the screen). Harder POIs give a bonus to what 7 Days To Die calls the Loot Stage, which determines what kinds of items you get from looting containers. A higher Loot Stage means you'll find rarer items as you explore. Your Loot Stage will naturally increase as you play the game, though Consumables like Eye Candy and the Treasure Hunter mod also give you small but significant increases to this stat.

item.title: 7 Days To Die: How To Get Wheels
item.description:
Even the smallest of maps in 7 Days To Die can be hard to explore on foot, but thankfully, players can make a number of different vehicles to make their travels less tedious. Naturally, you'll need to get some components before you can make your vehicle of choice, and that includes wheels.

Wheels are somewhat hard to find early on, especially if your luck isn't as good as you want it to be. Still, there are some ways to make your search less time-consuming, giving you ample time to prepare for your first few nights in 7 Days To Die .

Where To Find Wheels In 7 Days To Die

If you're looking to loot some wheels, your best bet is to hit the garages of gas stations and mechanic shops. Check the vehicles, crates, and other large containers you find inside. They have a fairly low drop rate, but perks like Lucky Looter may help improve those chances. If wheels aren't appearing in containers at all, you may need to advance your loot stage first by finding or crafting better gear and completing trader quests.

Speaking of traders, they'll occasionally have some wheels for sale in exchange for Casino Tokens. If you have the coins to spare, you can buy wheels for around 900 Dukes each. If you don't, then consider doing more quests or collecting some of the best items to sell to 7 Days To Die traders and make money that way.

Players who manage to get lucky during their scavenging runs might come across magazines that unlock crafting recipes for wheels and other vehicle parts. The magazine you're looking for is called Vehicle Adventures — reading one of these magazines gives you one point for your Vehicle crafting skill. You need five points in that skill to unlock recipes for the Bicycle and, of course, wheels.

Once you do unlock the recipe for wheels, you'll need the following:

  • 3x Forged Iron: Made by smelting Iron and Clay in a Furnace. May occasionally be found as loot.
  • 24x Scrap Polymers: Obtained by scavenging garbage piles and plastic trash like traffic cones, or by dismantling electronics with a Disassembly Tool.
  • 2x Oil : Can be looted from gas stations, mechanic shops, and other industrial areas.
  • 15x Coal: Mined from Coal deposits.
  • 1x Acid: Can be looted from sinks, garbage piles, trucks, and Working Stiff crates, among many other similar loot sources.

Luckily, all of these resources are fairly easy to find. Raiding the best early POIs in 7 Days To Die can net you a healthy number of most of these resources. Coal, on the other hand, can be a little tricky to find in the beginning, but once you find a Coal vein in the wild, you'll have no issue getting more.

item.title: Pokemon: 7 Best Mega Evolutions (Based On Stats)
item.description:
Highlights

  • Mega Garchomp's health stat ranks it as one of the top Mega Evolved Pokemon, boasting 108 health points.
  • Mega Mewtwo X holds the highest attack stat at 190, making it an incredibly powerful Pokemon.
  • Mega Rayquaza stands out as the best all-round stats, boasting a staggering 780.

Introduced in the Pokemon X and Y series of games, Mega Evolution changed the Pokemon meta with newly evolved forms of pocket monsters such as Mewtwo and Charizard. Due to the popularity of Mega Evolution, the gimmick will make a return in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , which follows the history of the Kalos region's capital, Lumiose City.

While only select Pokemon can Mega Evolve, the process enables Pokemon to learn new abilities, such as Mega Venusaur's fire-resistant ability, 'Thick Fat,' or Mega Rayquaza's 'Delta Stream' power. Likewise, Mega Evolution changes the Pokemon's appearance and increases their stats to levels far beyond the capabilities of normal evolved Pokemon. Based on stats, however, just what Mega Evolved Pokemon stand among the most powerful?

7 Mega Garchomp

Highest HP Stat (108)

HP

108

Attack

170

Defense

115

Special Attack

120

Special Defense

95

Speed

92

The ferocious mega Garchomp can be evolved using the mega stone 'Garchompite.' Known for being the trusty partner of the Sinnoh champion Cynthia and one of the strongest Sinnoh Pokemon, Garchomp levels up in appearance and power once Mega Evolved.

Donning scythes for hands and the ability 'Sand Force' that increases a move's power during sandstorms, Mega Garchomp is a force to be reckoned with. A Mega Evolved Garchomp has the best health stat of Mega Evolved Pokemon, coming in at 108 health points. It is lethal in terms of power and has the health of a walking tank to back it up.

6 Mega Mewtwo X

Highest Attack Stat (190)

HP

106

Attack

190

Defense

100

Special Attack

154

Special Defense

100

Speed

130

One of the two Mega Evolutions that Mewtwo can evolve into, Mega Mewtwo X, is the most powerful Pokemon in series history with the highest attack.

Mewtwo X has a whopping 190 base attack, dealing an additional ten more damage than Mega Heracross, which comes in at a close second. Mega Mewtwo X is tied with Mega Mewtwo Y and Mega Rayquaza as having the highest overall combined stats.

5 Mega Mewtwo Y

Highest Special Attack Stat (194)

HP

106

Attack

150

Defense

70

Special Attack

194

Special Defense

120

Speed

140

Much like Mega Mewtwo X, Mewtwo Y is a powerhouse regarding stats, boasting an egregious 194 special attack stat. This is the highest special attack of all Mega Evolved Pokemon and every Pokemon ever.

Moves such as Psychic and Psystrike are particularly powerful, with Mega Mewtwo Y mopping up the competition because of them. Like Mewtwo X, its stat total comes in at a staggering 780, making this Pokemon a true force to be reckoned with.

4 Mega Latias

Highest Special Defense Stat (150)

HP

80

Attack

100

Defense

120

Special Attack

140

Special Defense

150

Speed

110

An often overlooked Mega Evolution, Mega Latias can be evolved from the legendary Pokemon Latias using the mega stone Latiosite. Much like its pre-evolved form, Mega Latias has the ability 'Levitate,' which grants full immunity to ground-type moves.

Mega Latias has the best special defense of its Mega Evolved counterparts. Defending against special attack moves like 'Flamethrower' is very easy due to the pocket monster's sky-high 150 special defense stat.

3 Mega Steelix

Highest Defense Stat (230)

HP

75

Attack

125

Defense

230

Special Attack

55

Special Defense

95

Speed

30

On the defense side, Mega Steelix is tied as the best Mega Evolution in terms of defense. Known for its hardened, steely exterior and high base defense stat of 200, Steelix, on its own, has an exponentially high defense stat that can ward off even the most powerful attacks.

The upgrade to Mega Steelix increases this stat further to 230. Once mega evolved, crystals protrude from its body and are surrounded by floating rocks. Mega Steelix is arguably one of the harder Mega Evolutions to obtain due to the need to trade an Onix with a metal coat before it evolves into a normal Steelix.

2 Mega Aggron

Highest Defense Stat (230)

HP

70

Attack

140

Defense

230

Special Attack

60

Special Defense

80

Speed

50

Mega Aggron, the iron armor Pokemon, ties with Mega Steelix for the highest defense. Fierce in nature, Aggron is known to defend its territory aggressively, claiming an entire mountain for its own. Mega Aggron pushes its abilities to the next level with a defense stat of 230.

Once the pocket monster has undergone Mega Evolution, it dons more armor plates with a hardened defense. Though matching the same defense as Mega Steelix, Mega Aggron has the overall higher combined stats of 630.

1 Mega Rayquaza

Best All-Round Stats (780)

HP

105

Attack

180

Defense

100

Special Attack

180

Special Defense

100

Speed

115

The legendary Pokemon Rayquaza never needed an upgrade, but Game Freak gave it one in the remakes of Pokemon Ruby and Sapphire : Pokemon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire , which released in 2014. Mega Raquaza, much like Mewtwo X and Y, was banned from competitive play due to being too powerful. It had the highest overall stat of any Pokemon.

This pocket monster is a battle machine in every sense, with an attack and special attack of 180, defensive equivalents at 100, and some of the largest health and the best speed stats in Pokemon meta. The highest stats combined with 'Delta Stream' and a cooler design (if that is possible) place Rayquaza at the top of the pecking order regarding the best Mega Evolutions with the highest stats .
